summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the submission of financial records from Municipal Credit Union (MCU) in response to a federal grand jury subpoena from the Southern District of New York. The attached records include account signature cards and statements for accounts belonging to Clyde Washington and Tova Noel, showing transactions and balances in 2019. This document contains multiple monthly bank statements (February, January, July, and June 2019) for a Municipal Credit Union account belonging to Tova A. Noel. The statements show routine personal transactions including deposits from government payroll, loan payments, and everyday purchases. The document appears to be financial records likely obtained as part of the Epstein investigation, possibly to trace financial activity of individuals connected to the case. This document contains multiple bank account statements from the Municipal Credit Union (MCU) for an account holder named Tova A. Noel, covering the periods March, May, and June 2019. It shows regular deposits from government entities (DFEC, DOJ, AGRI Treasuries) and personal expenditures, along with details of an associated personal loan. This document is a business record certification and account statement from Municipal Credit Union, produced in response to a subpoena. It contains account information, transaction history, and a certification by a custodian verifying the records. The account holder appears to be an individual with ties to the New York City Department of Probation. This document contains multiple monthly bank statements (January, February, and July 2019) for an account holder at MCU (Municipal Credit Union). The statements show routine personal transactions, deposits from government entities (DOJ, IRS, AGRI TREAS), and transfers between accounts. No direct references to Epstein, his associates, or related legal events are present in this financial data. This document is a series of bank account statements (checking and savings) from MCU (Municipal Credit Union) for an account holder in Brooklyn, NY, covering March, June, and July 2019. It shows routine personal transactions including purchases, bill payments, and direct deposits from 'AGRI TREAS 310' (likely a federal salary). The document appears to be financial discovery material, possibly related to tracking an individual's financial activity. This document is a bank statement and account profile from the Municipal Credit Union (MCU) for an account holder named ANDREA, covering May 2019. It shows detailed transaction history, including deposits from 'AGRI TREAS 310' (likely federal salary), numerous retail purchases, and travel-related expenses to Miami, FL. The account profile indicates the member works for the 'DEPT OF PROBATION'. This document is a set of bank records from Municipal Credit Union, including a Business Record Certification responding to a subpoena, an account application form, and monthly statements for April and February 2019. The records show transactions for an account holder, including deposits from the U.S. Department of Agriculture and the Department of Justice. This document contains bank statements (checking account transaction histories) from MCU (Municipal Credit Union) for account numbers 0968053 (Feb 2019), 0956847 (Jan 2019), and 0329201 (Jul 2019). It shows numerous daily transactions including purchases, ATM withdrawals, and deposits, primarily in the New York area. The statements appear to be part of financial discovery in the Epstein case, likely tracking the spending patterns of an individual associated with the investigation. This document contains multiple monthly bank statements (checking account summaries and transaction histories) from the Municipal Credit Union (MCU) for an account holder. The statements cover periods in March, June, and July 2019, showing routine personal expenditures, deposits from 'AGRI TREAS 310' (likely federal salary), and payments to entities like Honda. It appears to be a financial record subpoenaed or entered into evidence, possibly to establish patterns, alibis, or financial connections in the broader Epstein case. This document is a bank statement and account profile from the Municipal Credit Union for an account holder, covering the period May 1-31, 2019. It shows detailed transaction history including purchases, ATM withdrawals, and direct deposits from a federal agency, as well as personal identification and account information for the member. This document is a collection of financial records from Municipal Credit Union (MCU) related to a specific account, including a business record certification, an account signature card, and multiple ACH stop payment requests. The records were produced in response to a subpoena and show account activity and attempts to stop payments to various merchants in August 2019. This document is a bank statement from Municipal Credit Union (MCU) for an account holder in Brooklyn, NY, covering the period April 1-30, 2019. It details numerous transactions including purchases, ATM withdrawals, and deposits, notably from 'AGRI TREAS 310' and 'DOJ TREAS 310'. The statement also includes a loan summary and a previous statement for February 2019. This document contains multiple monthly bank statements (January and July 2019) for an account holder at Municipal Credit Union (MCU). It details numerous transactions including payroll deposits, ATM withdrawals, debit card purchases, and loan payments, primarily in Brooklyn and New York City. The statements show regular payroll deposits from the City of New York and the US Department of Agriculture, and payments to various creditors. This document is a bank statement (FASTRACK CHECKING) for an MCU account covering June and July 2019, showing numerous transactions including purchases, transfers, and deposits from entities like AGRI TREAS 310 and DOJ TREAS 310. It reveals routine personal spending patterns and recurring financial obligations. This document contains two monthly bank statements (March and May 2019) for an account holder at the Municipal Credit Union (MCU). The statements show detailed transaction histories, including payroll deposits from government entities, loan payments, and numerous retail purchases and ATM withdrawals in New York and Georgia. The account holder appears to be a federal employee. This document contains bank statements and account profile information from the Municipal Credit Union for an account holder, covering transactions from May 2019 and a profile snapshot from September 2019. It shows routine financial activity, a large deposit, and account warnings including a 'DELINQUENT LOAN'. This document is an FBI FD-302 form summarizing the response from Navy Federal Credit Union to a federal grand jury subpoena issued by the Southern District of New York. It includes the subpoena, a certification statement, and detailed credit card statements for an account belonging to a Department of Justice employee, showing account activity from late 2018 through mid-2019. This document is a collection of Navy Federal Credit Union financial statements and credit card statements for an account holder. It shows account activity, payments, fees, and interest charges from late 2018 through mid-2019. The statements indicate the account holder had financial difficulties, including overdrafts, late payments, and a maxed-out credit card. This document is a bank statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for account holder(s) associated with the Epstein case, covering the period from February 24, 2019, to April 23, 2019. It details numerous transactions including debit card purchases, ATM withdrawals, transfers, and overdraft fees, primarily in New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania. The statement shows patterns of spending and cash withdrawals relevant to financial investigation. This document is a collection of bank statements and a credit card application from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account holder, covering the period from March 2019 to August 2019. It shows detailed transaction histories, including numerous purchases, ATM withdrawals, and recurring deposits from 'Agri Treas 310 Fed Sal', suggesting a government salary. The statements reveal frequent overdrafts and associated fees. A separate credit card application from 2014 is also included. This document is a collection of credit card statements and related financial documents from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account holder in Brunswick, GA, spanning from late 2018 through mid-2019. It shows transaction details, payments, interest charges, and includes a membership application form. The documents appear to be part of a financial records disclosure in the Epstein case, potentially related to tracing financial activity. This document is a bank statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for account number 5737231, covering the period January 15, 2019, to February 14, 2019. It shows transactions for checking and savings accounts, including deposits from 'Agri Treas 310 Fed Sal', transfers, and payments to various merchants. The account holder appears to be 'Man L Layne'. This document is a series of bank statements from Navy Federal Credit Union for account number 5737231, covering the period from February 15, 2019, to August 14, 2019. The statements detail transactions for a checking and savings account, including deposits from 'Agri Treas 310 Fed Sal', transfers, bill payments, and debit card purchases. The account holder's name appears to be Allan L. Layne. The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting these financial records were obtained as evidence.

connections.description: Danielle Jones is a duly authorized custodian of records acting on behalf of Municipal Credit Union.
Patricia Gonzalez, as a notary public, officially witnessed and notarized the certifications made by Danielle Jones.
Khadijah Ibrahim is listed as the sponsor or member service representative on the account signature card for Clyde Washington's account.
Multiple financial transactions, including Cash App transfers and purchases, are made from MR's account to or involving TANIA.
Cash App transfers are made from MR's account to TATIAN on May 4, 2019.
A Cash App transfer is made from MR's account to ROGER on May 12, 2019.
The names appear to refer to the same individual based on identical transaction patterns (receiving transfers from the same account), suggesting OCR or data entry errors for the name.
The names appear to refer to the same individual based on identical transaction patterns (receiving transfers from the same account), suggesting OCR or data entry errors for the name.

events.title: MCU Subpoena Response Submission
events.description: Municipal Credit Union provides certified financial records to the FBI in response to a federal grand jury subpoena from the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Large Deposit to Clyde Washington Account
events.description: A deposit of $7,912.53 is made to Clyde Washington's Primary Share account at the MCU Oceanside Branch.

events.description: Danielle Jones certifies financial records from Municipal Credit Union in response to a subpoena.

events.description: Multiple transactions indicate travel to Miami, Florida, including purchases for JetBlue flights, a Courtyard by Marriott hotel, and dining in Miami Beach.

events.title: Bank Account Opened
events.description: An individual applied for and opened a membership and checking account at Municipal Credit Union.

events.title: DOJ Treasury Deposit
events.description: A deposit of $600.00 was made into the account from 'DOJ TREAS 310', described as a miscellaneous payment.

events.title: Large Withdrawal at Helzberg Diamonds
events.description: A withdrawal of $1,746.96 was made at Helzberg Diamonds in Garden City, NY.

events.title: USDA Salary Deposit
events.description: A deposit of $3,061.79 was made from 'AGRI TREAS 310', identified as a federal salary payment.

events.title: Multiple ACH Stop Payment Requests Filed
events.description: The account holder filed multiple ACH stop payment requests to halt payments to Citibank/Citicards, Macy's, Lexington Law, Best Buy, PayPal, and Discover.

events.description: The account holder filed an ACH stop payment request to halt payments to Capital One.

events.title: Account Statement Period End
events.description: The statement period for the account ended, showing a checking balance of $1,138.63 and a personal loan balance of $761.32.

events.title: Multiple Cash App Transfers
events.description: A series of large Cash App transfers totaling $870 are made to TANIA and TATIAN.

events.title: Travel to Georgia
events.description: Numerous transactions occur in Brunswick and Glynn County, Georgia, including at the FLETC (Federal Law Enforcement Training Centers) Express ATM, suggesting the account holder was traveling or training there.

events.title: ATM Withdrawals in Brooklyn
events.description: Two ATM withdrawals and a fee from an ATM located at 1293 Bushwick Ave, Brooklyn, NY.

events.title: Multiple ACH Payments and Federal Salary Deposit
events.description: Numerous automatic payments to creditors (Capital One, PayPal, Citi Card, Discover, State Farm) and a deposit of a federal salary from 'AGRI TREAS 310'.

events.title: Withdrawal and Deposit by Doe
events.description: A withdrawal of $5.00 from a checking account and a deposit of $5.00 to a share account conducted by 'Doe' at the Brooklyn branch.

events.title: Large Check Deposit
events.description: A deposit of $7,912.53 to a share account at the Oceanside branch, consisting of two checks totaling $7,912.53, with a hold placed on the funds.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena (Ref No. 2019R01059) to Navy Federal Credit Union, demanding financial records for an investigation into alleged violations of federal statutes.

events.title: Credit Union Subpoena Response
events.description: Navy Federal Credit Union provided documents, including credit card statements and account details, in response to the grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Credit Card Application Approved
events.description: A credit card application for a Navy Federal nRewards Visa card was submitted and approved for an individual listing their employer as the Department of Justice.

events.title: Next Credit Card Statement Closing

events.title: Government Shutdown Program Credit
events.description: A credit of $1,500.00 was posted to the checking account, labeled as 'Government Shutdown Program Credit'.

events.title: Credit Card Application Submitted and Approved
events.description: A credit card application for a 'Visa Signature cashRewards' card was submitted and approved with a credit limit of $5,000.00 and an APR of prime plus 6.4%.

events.title: Credit Card Statement Closing
events.description: A credit card statement closed with a new balance of $5,099.94, a past due amount, and a minimum payment due of $102.00 by February 8, 2019.

keyFacts: The FBI obtained financial records from Municipal Credit Union via a federal grand jury subpoena issued by the Southern District of New York as part of an investigation (File# 90A-NY-3151227-GJ).
The records include account information for individuals named Clyde Washington and Tova A. Noel, showing transaction details and balances from 2019.
The credit union certified that the provided records did not include checks, credit card statements, Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs), or Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs).
Clyde Washington's account shows a substantial deposit of $7,912.53 on July 22, 2019, with portions subject to availability holds.
Tova Noel's account statements from February and April 2019 show regular payroll deposits from 'AGRI TREAS 310' (likely a federal salary) and numerous debit/credit card purchases.
The bank statements belong to Tova A. Noel, with an address in Bronx, NY 10456-3118.
Regular deposits are made from 'AGRI TREAS 310' and 'DFEC TREAS 310', indicating federal government payroll deposits.
The account shows routine personal expenses including shopping, dining, Uber rides, and loan payments.
The document includes statements from January, February, June, and July 2019, showing consistent financial activity patterns.
No direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or illegal activities are present in this financial record.
The account holder Tova A. Noel received regular ACH deposits from 'DFEC TREAS 310', 'DOJ TREAS 310', and 'AGRI TREAS 310', identified as 'MISC PAY' or 'FED SAL'.
The statements show a consistent pattern of a $185.00 monthly payment being transferred from the checking account to a personal loan (Loan 21).
The account had a 'DELINQUENT LOAN' warning that expired on April 13, 2017, and shows a history of NSF (Non-Sufficient Funds) occurrences in months 15, 16, and 17.
Expenditures are largely personal, including retail (Foot Locker, Victoria's Secret), dining, beauty services, Uber, and utility bills.
Financial records from Municipal Credit Union were certified on September 4, 2019, in response to a subpoena.
The account holder's basis for membership is 'Office Of Probation' and their employer is listed as 'DEPT OF PROBATION'.
The account statement for April 2019 shows numerous transactions including purchases at various retailers, online transfers, and automatic payments.
A significant transaction on April 30, 2019, was a $2,052.29 purchase at 'BLOOMYS' (Bloomington's) in New York.
The document includes a membership application signature card dated January 21, 2009, showing the account was opened as a joint account.
The document is a series of personal bank statements from MCU for January, February, and July 2019.
Deposits include regular payments from 'DOJ TREAS 310', 'AGRI TREAS 310', and 'IRS TREAS 310', indicating the account holder receives federal salary or benefit payments.
Transactions show routine personal spending at retailers, gas stations, restaurants, and for services like cable, phone, and car payments in the New York/New Jersey area.
No names of individuals associated with the Epstein case are mentioned in the provided text.
The document appears to be a standard financial record with no evident connection to the Epstein case based on the provided content.
The account holder receives regular direct deposits labeled 'AGRI TREAS 310' and 'FED SAL', indicating likely federal government employment.
Spending patterns show frequent transactions in the New York/New Jersey area, including routine purchases at grocery stores, gas stations, retail chains, and restaurants.
The account activity covers March, June, and July 2019, showing consistent financial behavior over several months.
The document is a standard bank statement with no explicit mentions of individuals associated with the Epstein case, suggesting it is background financial data.
The account is with MCU (Municipal Credit Union) and includes both checking and savings accounts.
The account holder, Andrea, receives regular direct deposits identified as 'AGRI TREAS 310' with the description 'FED SAL', indicating a federal government salary.
The account profile lists Andrea's current employer as the 'DEPT OF PROBATION'.
Transaction records show travel to Miami, Florida in mid-May 2019, with expenses for flights (JetBlue), hotel (Courtyard by Marriott), and local dining.

Recurring deposits are made via ACH from 'AGRI TREAS 310', identified as 'FED SAL' (Federal Salary), suggesting the account holder is a federal government employee.

The document's inclusion in the Epstein case files suggests it may be relevant to tracing financial activities, establishing whereabouts, or understanding the background of an individual connected to the investigation.

Municipal Credit Union produced these records in response to a subpoena duces tecum, as certified by custodian Danielle Jones.

The account signature card indicates the primary account holder was an employee of the NYC Department of Homeless Services (DHS) with a gross monthly income of $3,500.

A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Navy Federal Credit Union in August 2019 as part of an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 201, 371, 1001, 1346, 1519, and 2.
The subpoena response includes detailed credit card statements for an account belonging to an individual who listed their employer as the 'DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE' with an annual salary of $57,000.
The credit card account (ending in 3275) was frequently past due and over its $2,500 limit in early 2019, accruing significant late fees and interest charges.
The account holder's mother's maiden name was listed as 'VASQUEZ' on the credit card application.
The document includes a Right to Financial Privacy Act (RFPA) reimbursement form, indicating the government's compliance with privacy laws when obtaining the financial records.
The financial statements are for a Navy Federal Credit Union account holder with an address in Middletown, NY (410 Middletown NY 10940-2589).
The credit card account (Visa) was consistently over its $2,500 limit and past due in mid-2019, with significant interest and fee charges.
The associated checking account showed numerous overdrafts, overdraft protection fees, and transactions in the New York City area.
A 'Government Shutdown Program Credit' of $1,500 was deposited into the checking account in January 2019, suggesting the account holder may have been a federal employee affected by the shutdown.
The document contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, victims, or properties; it appears to be personal financial records of an unrelated individual.
The bank statement shows a pattern of frequent cash withdrawals from ATMs, often at 7-Eleven locations, and numerous debit card transactions for retail, food, travel, and services.
Transactions occur primarily in the New York City area (Brooklyn, Bronx, Manhattan) and Pennsylvania (Bethlehem, Allentown, Whitehall, Easton), suggesting travel or activity in these regions.
The account incurred multiple overdraft protection fees, indicating periods of low balance and financial strain.
Recurring payments to entities like T-Mobile, State Farm Insurance, and Netflix are present, along with transfers to loans and credit cards.
The statement period is from February to April 2019, a time of active investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.
The account holder receives regular direct deposits labeled 'Deposit - ACH Paid From Agri Treas 310 Fed Sal', indicating a likely federal government salary.
The checking accounts show a pattern of frequent overdrafts, resulting in substantial overdraft protection fees totaling hundreds of dollars over the statement periods.
A credit card associated with the account holder had a balance of over $5,000 and was past due as of January 2019.
